info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 3:18AM CDT until June 30 at 4:47AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Big Sioux River near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Sioux River near Castlewood.
* WHEN...From early this morning to late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water overtops the culvert on 184th Street and significant agricultural flooding begins north of Castlewood. At 10.0 feet, 184th Street begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM CDT Sunday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise to 9.4 feet this morning. It is then forecast to fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 500 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT
